name: Palmiet Valley Wine Estate & Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The five star service we received was excellent and very personal - it felt like a home away from home.
reviews.title: A tranquil retreat ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved the 300 year old buildings and everything that dates back to that time, like the furnuture, bathrooms, etc.
reviews.title: Great place, wonderful rooms, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The venue is set in tranquil surroundings and we could truly forget about all our worries, while relaxing and having our every need catered for.
reviews.title: Very special and beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Most of all we loved the breakfasts - natural, organic and delicious. We would love to stay at Palmiet Valley Estate again!
reviews.title: Our perfect wedding at Palmiet Valley Estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Palmiet for a 4 night stay in the wine country - with six of us, all adults, all related. We found it through Greenwood Guides - which we've used for years and it has never disappointed. A bit pricey by South African standards, but very much worth it. Breakfast was great and we enjoyed a couple of dinners when we weren't at other wineries. The furniture and accoutrements in the rooms were all great - collectibles.
reviews.title: Wedding Weekend at the lovely Palmiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two night break at Palmiet Valley Estate. Our luxury room was situated upstairs under the thatch. Flowers, sherry, fruit are just some of the lovely touches in the room (really wrong to describe it as a room, more like a suite). The gardens are stunning and we really enjoyed breakfast and dinner (fantastic food) under the oak trees. The management and staff are very attentive and friendly. This will be a place we will return to and will certainly recommend anybody to stay there.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We book to come to a wedding in Paarl. Arranged to have the room an hour earlier to get ready and arrived to be told the room was not ready. We were then given the room 30 minutes before we needed to be collect by the taxi.
reviews.title: Poor service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxi was recommended and booked by the hotel for 2pm and the taxi arrived at 20 past and then had no idea how to get to the wedding venue, which was all confirmed by the hotel previously that this was all in order.
reviews.title: a wonderful find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were then departing early the following morning and were told that because we would miss breakfast they would make us some crossiants and leave them in the room. Only to arrive back that evening and another promise was not fulfilled.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful place to rest after a flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a Cape Town local, I know the wine district well-
reviews.title: Our Wedding at Palmiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is so stylish. It creates a relaxing atmosphere. If you stay at this estate don't miss the dinner. Sitting under oaks, with candles all around , to eat from magnificent porcelain is a wonderful experience. Food itself is tasty. It's not a cheap experience but if you like luxury and old style it's worth a visit
reviews.title: Stylish fantasy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not experience the estate as a holiday resort, but rather as the venue for our wedding ceremony and reception. I instantly fell in love with Palmiet Valley when I first viewed it as a possible wedding venue. It was everything I envisaged my wedding venue to be. After deciding on the estate as wedding venue, the wedding coordinator and rest of the Palmiet Valley team were amazing and assisted us with all the arrangements, and especially with the paranoia and stresses of a bride-to-be. Our wedding day once again was awesome, I will never ever forget my day, it was all that I wanted and more, I wanted my guests to have fun and that's exactly what they got. We could kick off our high heels and enjoy the lush gardens and awesome views the estate had to offer. The team was amazing, the food was excellent and the experience priceless. Palmiet Valley Estate is truly a gem hidden away in the lovely Paarl Valley, my hometown.
reviews.title: Arnelia and Predon's dream wedding experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From arrival till departure we had a wonderful feeling. We stayed for three nights in a very
reviews.title: Paradise to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: warm and friendly atmosphere. Excellent food and service, romantic bedroomes, very silent , rental car recommendet. A place to see and come again!
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delightful location, and I can quite see why it is highly sought after for weddings with its fabulous grounds.
reviews.title: A lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful buildings and situation. Very friendly reception and excellent dining
reviews.title: Splendid Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this beautiful estate, everything was just perfect! The room was amazing, location and grounds were so lovely to wander freely around, the owner and staff were so kind it's difficult to find fault. Food was amazing, drinks before dinner with the estate owner was a lovely touch, and Conrad the dog has to have a mention as he was just gorgeous, only tractors seem to bring out the bad side of him! All in all a lovely relaxing location, would certainly visit again.
reviews.title: Stunning location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: 5 nights at Palmiet Valley Estate were a stay I will not forget - it was just top (I stayed in the Presidents suite).. The ambiance of the 300+ year old buildings, a blend of reed grass roofs and old wooden structures in the rooms upstairs, but up to date with modern standards inside and the individual decorations of the rooms with antiques, the well maintained natural gardens surrounding the buildings are worthwhile a stay. Owner Fred and his team are extremely friendly, they took care of me, and thus made me feel home (probably even better). The excellent cuisine and service, the flower decorations on the tables and breakfast under the trees - just as perfect as I liked it. Wine and Guave plantations as part of the estate and the Drakenstein mountains in the background round up the location - a tranquil setting. As as for sports: I could play golf in the immediate neighborhood - just 10 minutes away. All in all a dream vacation - better than expected and absolutely recommendable. I will come back - next time with my wife, she will love it.
reviews.title: An oasis of tranquility and excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place seems to be straight out of a fairytale book - it is what any traveller to the Cape region is looking for. The buildings are from the 17th century in Dutch style and lovingly kept. To top it off, 2 blooming Jacaranda trees sit next to the main house. The grounds are exquisite. Our room, number 5, was quaint and cosy with a mosquito net (more for show, probably) and a luxurious bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. So sad we only stayed one night!
reviews.title: Maybe the most beautiful place I have stayed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I won a 2 night stay in the Presidential Suite of Palmiet Valley Estate. As u can imagine we were very excited as we had a look at all the beautiful pictures on their website before we went. Unfortunately the experience turned out to be horrible. Upon arrival we were told that we have been "upgraded" to the Honeymoon Suite...which was not an upgrade as it had no satelite TV, no mini-bar, no fireplace and costs half the price of the Presidential Suite. So they moved us to a "cheaper" room without any prior notice. Why offer a competition if you treat the winners like a "charity-case". The room we stayed in was really quite dirty and looked like it hadn't been attended to in months as the sugar was rock hard. I would never recommend Palmiet Valley to any friend or family member.
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed

description: Palmiet Valley is a producing Wine Estate in the heart of the Cape Wine Lands with thirteen romantic guest rooms in the historic Cape Dutch Manor House of the Estate. All rooms have en suite bathrooms and are furnished with the finest antiques. We have an international chef who is cooking exclusively for our house guests. We have been rated "Five Star" by the South African Tourism Grading Council.
